Description: Rim fragment of Attic red-figured pottery skyphos; inside glazed; outside,satyr and maenad, both part-preserved, facing; he holds out bunch of grapes in both hands, she a thyrsus in right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Roemer and Pelizaeus Museum, Hildesheim. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Marked in pencil on the inside '09' (?). Compare the tondo of a cup by the Angular Painter in Adria, Museo Civico B321 (CVA Adria (1) III Ipl. 41.4).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1299)
Kreuzer 2011 / Griechische, ptolemäische und römische Keramik im Roemer- und Pelizaeus-Museum Hildesheim (pp. 46-7 no. 50, pl. 33) (wrongly labelled 'Kat.-Nr. 51)
